text: It looks like if DRP gets a hostname from DHCP it will ignore the hostname assigned it in the machine definition.  Is there any way to override that and tell it to ignore the hostname it gets from DHCP and use the one I set instead?
<@U9BU09D51> is your DHCP running on DRP - or is it external infrastructure DHCP services ?

So (clearly) we can't make changes to external DHCP records, without implementing an integration/stage to do so.  However, the Machine can be provisioned with a DRP defined name - please refer to the `set-hostname` task, and it's subsequent `set-hostname.sh.tmpl` template.   You need to insure this Task is attached to a post-provisioning stage workflow to make the change to the Machine.

question why does a freshly discovered machines shortname prepend a 'd' before the mac address. IE d00-00-00-00-00-00
Fqdn does not like names that start with numbers.
<@UA02EUXF1> you can change the machine name - see the $faq
